==Events==
* [[506]] &ndash; The [[bishop]]s of [[Visigoth]]ic [[Gaul]] meet in the [[Council of Agde]].
*[[1419]] &ndash; [[John the Fearless]], [[Duke of Burgundy]] is assassinated by adherents of the [[Dauphin of France|Dauphin]], the future [[Charles VII of France]].
*[[1509]] &ndash; An earthquake known as "[[1509 Istanbul earthquake|The Lesser Judgment Day]]" hits [[Constantinople]].
*[[1515]] &ndash; [[Thomas Wolsey]] is invested as a [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|Cardinal]]
*[[1547]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Pinkie Cleugh]], the last full scale military confrontation between England and Scotland, resulting in a decisive victory for the forces of [[Edward VI of England|Edward VI]].
*[[1561]] &ndash; [[Battles of Kawanakajima|Fourth Battle of Kawanakajima]] &ndash; [[Takeda Shingen]] defeats [[Uesugi Kenshin]] in the climax of their ongoing conflicts.
*[[1570]] &ndash; Spanish [[Society of Jesus|Jesuit]] missionaries land in present-day Virginia to establish the short-lived [[Ajacán Mission]].
*[[1608]] &ndash; [[John Smith (explorer)|John Smith]] is elected [[council president]] of [[Jamestown, Virginia]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Nathan Hale]] volunteers to spy for the [[Continental Army]].
*[[1778]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Barret's Privateers|Elcid Barrett]]'s sloop The Antelope is sunk by "a bloody great Yankee" near [[Montego Bay]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; At the [[Battle of St. George's Caye]], [[British Honduras]] defeats Spain.
*[[1813]] &ndash; The United States defeats the [[British Fleet]] at the [[Battle of Lake Erie]] during the [[War of 1812]].
*[[1823]] &ndash; [[Simón Bolívar]] is named [[President of Peru]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Elias Howe]] is granted a patent for the [[sewing]] machine.
*[[1858]] &ndash; [[George Mary Searle]] discovers the asteroid [[55 Pandora]].
*[[1897]] &ndash; [[Lattimer massacre]]: A [[Posse comitatus (common law)|sheriff's posse]] kills 20 unarmed immigrant miners in [[Pennsylvania]], United States.
*[[1898]] &ndash; Empress [[Elisabeth of Bavaria|Elizabeth of Austria]] is assassinated by [[Luigi Lucheni]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Russian Civil War]]: The [[Red Army]] [[Kazan Operation|captures]] [[Kazan]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; Austria and the Allies sign the [[Treaty of Saint-Germain]] recognizing the independence of Poland, Hungary, [[Czechoslovakia]] and [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; The [[New York City Subway]]'s third competing subway system, the municipally-owned ''[[Independent Subway System|IND]]'', is opened.
*[[1936]] &ndash; First World Individual [[Motorcycle Speedway]] Championship, Held at London's (England) [[Wembley Stadium (1923)|Wembley Stadium]]
*[[1937]] &ndash; Nine nations attend the [[Nyon Conference]] to address international [[piracy]] in the Mediterranean Sea.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The submarine {{HMS|Oxley}} is mistakenly sunk by the submarine {{HMS|Triton|N15|6}} near Norway and becomes the [[Royal Navy]]'s first loss.
*  1939   &ndash; World War II: Canada declares war on [[Nazi Germany]], joining the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] &ndash; France, the United Kingdom, New Zealand and Australia.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: The British Army carries out an amphibious landing on [[Madagascar]] to re-launch Allied offensive operations in the [[Battle of Madagascar|Madagascar Campaign]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: German forces begin their occupation of Rome.
*[[1946]] &ndash; While riding a train to [[Darjeeling]], Sister Teresa Bojaxhiu of the Loreto Sisters' Convent claimed to have heard the call of God, directing her "to leave the convent and help the poor while living among them". She would become known as [[Mother Teresa]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; At the [[1960 Summer Olympics]] in Rome, [[Abebe Bikila]] becomes the first [[sub-Saharan Africa]]n to win a gold medal, winning the [[marathon]] in bare feet.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[1961 Italian Grand Prix|Italian Grand Prix]], a crash causes the death of German Formula One driver [[Wolfgang von Trips]] and 13 spectators who are hit by his [[Scuderia Ferrari|Ferrari]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; The people of [[Gibraltar]] [[Gibraltar sovereignty referendum, 1967|vote]] to remain a British dependency rather than becoming part of Spain.
*[[1972]] &ndash; The United States suffers its first loss of an international basketball game in a [[Basketball at the 1972 Summer Olympics#Gold Medal Match controversy|disputed match]] against the [[Soviet Union]] at the [[1972 Summer Olympics]] in [[Munich]], Germany.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Guinea-Bissau]] gains independence from Portugal.
*[[1976]] &ndash; A [[British Airways]] [[Hawker Siddeley Trident]] and an [[Adria Airways|Inex-Adria]] [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9|DC-9]] collide near [[Zagreb]], [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]], killing 176.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Hamida Djandoubi]], convicted of torture and murder, is the last person to be executed by [[guillotine]] in France.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] starts his 11-day papal visit to [[Fort Simpson]], Canada and afterwards to several southern and western cities in the United States.
*[[1990]] &ndash; The [[Basilica of Our Lady of Peace of Yamoussoukro|Basilica of Our Lady of Peace]] in [[Yamoussoukro]], [[Côte d'Ivoire]], the largest church in Africa, is consecrated by [[Pope John Paul II]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Operation Barras]] successfully frees six British soldiers held captive for over two weeks and contributes to the end of the [[Sierra Leone Civil War]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Charles Ingram]] cheats his way into winning one million pounds on a British version of [[Who Wants to be a Millionaire]].
*  2001   &ndash; [[Antonio da Costa Santos]], mayor of [[Campinas]], Brazil is assassinated.
*[[2002]] &ndash; Switzerland, traditionally a [[neutral country]], joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Anna Lindh]], the foreign minister of Sweden, is fatally stabbed while shopping, and dies the following day.
*[[2007]] &ndash; Former Prime Minister of Pakistan [[Nawaz Sharif]] returns to Pakistan after seven years in exile, following a military coup in October 1999.
*[[2008]] &ndash; The [[Large Hadron Collider]] at [[CERN]], described as the biggest scientific experiment in history, is powered up in [[Geneva]], Switzerland.
